alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 8:33PM CDT until August 06 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTY... At 933 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that slow moving thunderstorms produced heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell in the warned area. Rainfall had significantly decreased in the past hour and was light at this time. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area during the next hour. Flash flooding is still possible as runoff continues. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may still experience flash flooding include... Chattanooga, Ridgeside, Harrison, Collegedale, East Ridge, Ooltewah, Middle Valley and Harrison Bay State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 1 and 12. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
